message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is about dataless text classification using topic modeling. The primary focus is on natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) techniques, which are typically covered in the cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-categories. The paper also discusses techniques for incorporating supervision and improving classification accuracy, which are relevant to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses techniques such as spike and slab prior and weak smoothing prior, which are commonly used in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. Finally, the paper uses experiments on public datasets, which are typically covered in the cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-category.
